website_summaries.verdict: A good budget option for replacing most remote control fans for Harbor Breeze and other brand ceiling fans.
pros: Stands out for its long 40-foot working distance
Remote control can connect with taller ceiling fans or fans placed in different rooms of the home
cons: Universal features are difficult to set up with non-Harbor Breeze ceiling fans

customer_reviews.title: Works with Our Oldish Hunter Fan. Yay!
customer_reviews.text: Worked with our 15+ year old Hunter fan. (Don't know the model #.) Looks exactly like the OEM remote, except for the name on the front of the remote. Don't throw away your defunct remote before receiving this one, because you will need to know the configuration of the DIP switches (inside the defunct remote) in order to configure your new remote control's DIP switches to work with your fan.
customer_reviews.author: Rene Gade

customer_reviews.title: Works for older Emerson Fans!
customer_reviews.text: All of the fans in our house were replaced in the first few years with Emerson units back in 02 and 03. Two have remotes and one remote had pretty much stopped working. Emerson doesn't sell the older model remotes like ours anymore and what they offered online were considerably more expensive than this Pikeman. The Pikeman remote looked identical to my old Emerson and used a four gang DIP switch to change frequency so I figured I would try it to see if was compatible. When it arrived I installed the 9 volt battery and aligned the DIP switchs to match my old unit and it works like a champ! Quality low cost replacement for older Emerson units!
customer_reviews.author: Cblow5

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works with the Merwry ceiling fan from Home Depot. Reset the code to match the controller.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Hall

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: This thing was a life saver!!! When we moved into our house, the bedroom ceiling fan was remote control powered. How neat! Until our dog chewed it up... couldn’t even tell what brand it was! For some reason I kept the chewed up remote in my nightstand... so glad I did! You will need to open up your old remote to find out the switch code used. There are 4 switches in the battery slot that would be coordinated with the fan itself. Luckily I had the old one! This has the holder so now it’s taped to my headboard and my dog can’t get to it there (or so I hope)
customer_reviews.author: Kimberlee P

customer_reviews.title: Performs perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly with a 1999 Hampton Bay ceiling fan with light kit, operating the fans, lights and dimmer at a touch. Be sure you keep your original remote: there are 4 small frequency switches inside the battery compartment, that have to be set in the same (up or down) position as the original device. (I set them in seconds, using a small “eyeglass” screwdriver.) The remote mounts to the wall with the same holster-type holder as the original. I swapped out the original using the same holes, to get a holder that’s the same color as the new remote (a brighter white).
customer_reviews.author: Nan L.

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT DISCARD THE OLD ONE UNTIL YOU GET THE NEW ONE!
customer_reviews.text: Super easy, works great! However, be sure to keep the old one so you know how to set the pins. I was afraid I wouldn't be able to find a replacement because my fan is nearly 20 yrs old but this one works very well. Simply set the internal pins in the same configuration as the old one was set and you are good to go!
customer_reviews.author: The LV Desert Rat

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Directions were quite confusing. Just take your time to read through them. It took me a few minutes to make sure I was programming correctly. It's working just fine in replacing an old remote. It's identical to my old one. Be careful with the switches on the inside of the remote when you need to adjust the dials to the correct settings, they're very fragile. One of the clips broke as I went to set them. It was a great deal for the price though. I purchased a few extras to keep on hand should the need arise for my other fans in the house.
customer_reviews.author: ChrisC

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job
customer_reviews.text: Have had a ceiling fan for a few years. The last couple of years, it always seemed like the remote needed batteries as it was slow to respond or hard to get it to respond. I probably put 4 or 5 new batteries in the thing and assumed I had bad batteries. Tried this replacement and it's like night and day. This one looks like my old one (except for the reverse button which I don't use anyway). Made sure it had the 4 switches inside, set it the way the old one was and it's been working great.
customer_reviews.author: SoCalGuy

customer_reviews.title: Not all functions work
customer_reviews.text: I am happy that the remote works, (on/off, light on/off) but found that the fan speed does not change between different settings (Low, Med, High). I am not sure if I received a faulty remote or it is not compatible. When purchasing this item, the item was listed as replacement remote for Harbor Breeze Hunter KUJCE9103.
customer_reviews.author: dead_glittery_things

customer_reviews.title: Amazing.
customer_reviews.text: Our fan is a Hunter. My husband started doing research at hardware stores and even the manufacturer thinking he would have to recode a new remote. Not easy with 12' ceilings. I went to Amazon and ordered this. Package arrived. Hubby opened it up, pointed it at the fan and it started immediately. Amazing? No, Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: duedilligent

customer_reviews.title: Fast to ship, easy to install.
customer_reviews.text: Quick to set up, just match the switches with the switches in your remote controlled celling fan/light. The remote that came with the light fixture used a bazaar rated battery that will be difficult to replace, this one uses a normal 9V battery just like most fire detectors. Definitely recommend for someone looking for a replacement or additional remote,
customer_reviews.author: TanmanJF

customer_reviews.title: Great value and works as expected
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a replacement for the OEM remote that came with his Hampton Bay fan/light. It is an exact match and the dip switches were very easy to configure. I would recommend this to anyone who is looking for this remote replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent replacement for factory remote
customer_reviews.text: Excellent replacement for the factory remote. The remote for our master bedroom fan went out and we couldn’t turn the lights on. Make sure to check the dip switches on the original remote before tossing it. Took 2 seconds to put batteries in, set it, and it worked perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Garner

customer_reviews.title: SAVED ME FROM BUYING A NEW FAN
customer_reviews.text: MY CASABLANCA KITCHEN FAN REMOTE STOPPED WORKING COMPLETELY. EVEN BEFORE THAT, IT WOULD ONLY TURN THE FAN ON HIGH AND OFF. ANOTHER ODD THING ABOUT IT WAS THAT IT ALSO TURNED ON AND OFF MY NEW EMERSON FAN JUST INSTALLED ON MY PORCH ABOUT 15 YARDS AWAY. MY WIFE WAS LOOKING A FAN REPLACEMENTS WHEN I SAW THIS ON AMAZON. IT WORKED PERFECTLY ON THE KITCHEN FAN WITH ALL BUTTONS. A+
customer_reviews.author: keaise

customer_reviews.title: It worked right out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: My original remote was old and wouldn't work unless I pressed the buttons super hard and even then it didn't always work. I found this remote on Amazon and it looks just like my original. The dip switches were aleeady set up the same so this new remote worked right away. What's nice is that this new remote also has a glow in the dark button which makes it easier to see.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Everything you need, nothing you don't...
customer_reviews.text: This was the perfect replacement remote for my ceiling fan. All the remotes at the local store came with the fan controller and cost twice as much. This was easy, just match up the pins, put a fresh 9v in there and you're back in business.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Ingandela

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Needed to replace the remote for my Emerson Ceiling fan/light fixture. The buttons look exactly the same so took a shot. Just need to set the dip switches to be the same as the old remote and it works like a champ.
customer_reviews.author: pcguy63

customer_reviews.title: it is not the best remote on the planet
customer_reviews.text: It works, it is easy to install, it seems weak signal or poor antenna wire idk which it is in my house and we use it in our guest room. so, not heavy use so the holding of the remote in the right spot is not a constant problem for me, no replacing it lol.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: We had a ceiling fan with light which may be a Hampton Bay from The Home Depot that the previous homeowner didn’t leave us the remote for, so we weren’t able to use it for the 2 years that we have owned the house. I saw this remote and thought for around $20 that I should try to see if it would work for our fan/light. After trying several of the 16 codes, I found the one that worked. I am very happy with this remote. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: TD in VB

customer_reviews.title: Worked fine with "Learn" button
customer_reviews.text: This does have a LEARN button, as was required by our Harbor Breeze, Model: LP8137 Fan. My LP8137 does not have dip-switches on the fan itself, thus the LEARN button is required. I had to turn OFF the circuit breaker to the fan two (2) times to get it to work ... it LEARNED the second attempt and works fine now. I use a replacement LED bulb in the fan, which never goes 100% OFF, so it is like having a night-light in our large Family Room, which we are fine with.
customer_reviews.author: Old Guy

customer_reviews.title: So Far, Good
customer_reviews.text: A Harbor Breeze ceiling fan was rendered non-functioning by a power surge. Problem is, Harbor Breeze does not offer a replacement fix. There are the "universal" replacements, but not an exact. So, had to go online to find this. Took an electrician to install; the wiring took some working to fit in the base of the fan. So far, all is working. If this stops working, will go with a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: EchoTango

customer_reviews.title: Worked great 👍
customer_reviews.text: Omg 😳 so many great things can be said about. After removing fan from ceiling installing part took about 2 minutes and additional 5 minutes more to put fan back on ceiling. So you are look 👀 at about 10 minutes in total. Part worked great and came with everything I need it. I would highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Rafael

customer_reviews.title: Had to modify the Harbor Breeze base
customer_reviews.text: I got 4 to install in harbor breeze ceder shoals out door ceiling fans made especially for Lowe's, the cast base that holds the fan and the receiver Head to have a small projection cut off to get the receiver to fit in it's slot. The instructions are very fine print and it took trial and error to realize that you must double-click the light button to get it to dim. Other than that, everything is working fine. This is written after five days of use.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: It worked perfectly !
customer_reviews.text: The fan remote control did not work anymore. By using another remote control command I figured that the problem was the receiver.. I got a new receiver which was so easy to install. And it worked perfectly. I have now 2 commands. because you receive a kit with command and receiver !
customer_reviews.author: Jose Dallas

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfect for me!!!
customer_reviews.text: worked perfectly for my 13 year old hunter fan. My old remote stopped working in light mode so i swapped out old transmitter and remote with this combo and voila, back to normal, made sure to move at least one of the dip switches to off, good to go
customer_reviews.author: B. Rivas

customer_reviews.title: I never knew the happiness a working remote could bring!
customer_reviews.text: Thank goodness this thing works! It replaced the old one in our new house and was extremely simple to program. My one complaint is that the "1" is in the position of the "high" setting of my former fan and the "3" is in the position of the "low" setting, which is kind of annoying. I'd expect this to be the case for many consumers. Fortunately, only my family lives in my home and we can deal with the minor inconvenience of a perfectly working remote.
customer_reviews.author: ABMama

customer_reviews.title: it works!
customer_reviews.text: We had an old'ish ceiling fan installed in the master bedroom. The old remote looked like it had been through a warzone which meant that I was on Amazon.com looking for its replacement. Sure enough... matched up the part numbers and had a new one in 2 days. Works like a charm, although, funny enough, we don't even use it... but it does look nice mounted on the wall next to the light switch.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Perfect replacement for the original Harbor Breeze ceiling fan wireless remote control
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly as a replacement for my original Harbor Breeze ceiling fan wireless remote control. One of the fan speed buttons on the original remote control failed and purchasing this replacement remote was less expensive than buying an entire fan remote control system. It's physically identical to the OEM other than the logo at the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: T. Romano

customer_reviews.title: Randomly dims light
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to install and I like the remote. The light randomly dims then goes bright since installing
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Schulz

customer_reviews.title: Great Replacement Remote
customer_reviews.text: Our other remote stopped working properly (would not turn out lights after 5 years of use). The installation was easier than I thought it would be but had to almost take the ceiling fan apart to get it installed but that probably was due to the design of the fan.
customer_reviews.author: jb

customer_reviews.title: Bummer
customer_reviews.text: It did not work as a replacement for my fan.
customer_reviews.author: Judy

customer_reviews.title: Good as a kit not so much by itself
customer_reviews.text: Giving this only 3 stars because they are not compatible with most remotes out there. If you buy the remote that they offer you in this kit however, they work perfectly together. Ask me how I found that out.......
customer_reviews.author: Luis Tambunga

customer_reviews.title: Works but not as pictured
customer_reviews.text: The remote works great, but it is not the one pictured for sale. I have attached a picture of the one I received. I searched to find one just like the original remote and ordered it, but I received this egg shaped one. I am keeping it, because it does work even though it is not as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: D Wheat

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect!
customer_reviews.text: We bought our new home and couldn’t figure out how to turn on the ceiling fan / light. After a bit of googling, we found this remote and it works perfect! Easy to install the hanger!
customer_reviews.author: Byron J. Batista

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, wires labeled, worked great!
customer_reviews.text: This was very easy to install as the wires were individually labeled and pre-cut so a wire stripper wasn't required. The color of the wires even matched my old receiver so it was a quick job to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 15 minutes to fix the fan
customer_reviews.text: Perfect replacement for a hunter receiver that had a burnt resistor (common based on online reviews). The only complaints would be the remote is large and the motor seems to make more noise than before. TheLongstar LED A19s that came with the fan originally were not compatible, but some Feit LEDs we had on hand worked great. Worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works the fan fine.
customer_reviews.text: Could only get it to operate the fan. No matter what we did it wouldn't operate fan and light. Since it worked for fan we kept it. Still havent gotten it to work the light.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Worked right out of the box,
customer_reviews.text: I was thinking it would require programing or maybe I just got lucky and it was already programed for my fan, just put a battery in it and it worked. Looks exactly like the original remote too.
customer_reviews.author: Dave L

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with Hunter Ceiling Fan
customer_reviews.text: My kids broke the remote that originally came with my Hunter ceiling fan and I have been trying to find a universal remote as replacement. This seemed like a good option and sounded like it would work based on the description and other comments, but no luck. I don't have the pin code from the old remote, but I tried all possible combinations on this remote and none of them worked. Very disappointed. Will be returning. Now to find another one to try!
customer_reviews.author: Kara DiCaterino

customer_reviews.title: Mounted on a close mount fan
customer_reviews.text: The remote receiver does not fit well with my close mount ceiling fan, but I was able to attach it inside the cover using zip ties. Once it was mounted and the fan was assembled it has worked fine.
customer_reviews.author: DZ

customer_reviews.title: Worked great
customer_reviews.text: Worked great. Saved me from having to buy a new fan. Fixed a Allen and Roth hugger. Set both set of dip switches the same and you’re good to go.
customer_reviews.author: bonna bing

customer_reviews.title: Exact match for our bad controller
customer_reviews.text: This remote control was the perfect match replacement for the one that came with our ceiling fan/light that went bad. Very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly D.

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but doesn't dim LED's all the way.
customer_reviews.text: Pikeman gets 5 stars for quick and helpful reply to a technical question. The fan/light receiver worked perfectly with my existing remote as promised. The only negative I could cite is that the LED light fixtures don't dim all the way down. Just how far they dim will probably depend on total wattage and the particulars of the fixtures. I used it with 6 can fixtures and they dim to where they look equivalent to approximately old 20 watt frosted incandescent bulbs. However, when you turn them off, they are completely off.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Mortellite

customer_reviews.title: Forget it
customer_reviews.text: I ended up hard wiring the lights (fan is disabled). Unit is in the trash. These units seem to be sensitive.
customer_reviews.author: 1X2X4

customer_reviews.title: Great remote!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great remote!!!! Was super easy to connect with my fan! I broke my Original fan remote and this one was incredibly easy to set up. Super find!
customer_reviews.author: Marina

customer_reviews.title: It does work but physical size of unit makes it difficult to install
customer_reviews.text: Only way to get this unit to fit in my ceiling fan was to remove the outer shell and tape up the PCB so it doesn't short out the ceiling fan. If I knew the physical size of the unit or it's compatible ceiling fan models I most likely would not have purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: blaine carvalho

customer_reviews.title: Easy as easy can be to install
customer_reviews.text: Simple install after I took the fan apart. Wires were color coded as well as labeled very well. Remote is much easier to use then the one I replaced it with. Good product and was exactly what it said it was. Best part is it uses a 9 volt battery. My last fan remote I had to order batteries as no one in town had them
customer_reviews.author: john a keller

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Good product. Works well. The color is a bit dingy, and there is no battery included which was annoying. But worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I’m Very Pleased
customer_reviews.text: It works like a charm. Ceiling fans are awkward and heavy, so that makes installation a little Less than easy, but adding in the remote is fairly simple. And now my ceiling fans have remotes like they should have come with.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck E.G.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect replacement
customer_reviews.text: Perfect replacement for original remote control for Ocean Breeze fan. Old model, so wasn’t sure it would work, but, once I set the dip switches, worked perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Michael M. Makieve

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: This is the first "add-on" fan remote I've ever purchased. I have/installed ceiling fans with remotes and I know the install process. This one was just as easy. It even does a nice job of dimming (dimmable) LED bulbs.
customer_reviews.author: Boomer Sooner

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to replace an old remote that broke- wires connecting to battery disconnected. Found this item and based on reviews, I thought it would work with my old fan. It did! Simple and easy to get it to work. So glad, too, because I really didn’t want to go through the trouble of installing a new remote box in an old fan or have to replace the fan. If you buy this item to replace an old remote, make sure you don’t throw out the old one before you buy this. You’ll need to match the codes from old to new.
customer_reviews.author: a.w.

customer_reviews.title: Works like it should.
customer_reviews.text: Moved and the fan in one bedroom did not have a remote. This one worked just fine and matches the other ones we have in the other rooms.
customer_reviews.author: Linda A Barnett

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: it worked great with our fun. opened, put batteries and no need for setting it up or input any code.
customer_reviews.author: NVB

customer_reviews.title: Works good.
customer_reviews.text: The remote works just like the original one. It controls with off and on fan speed and light diming.
customer_reviews.author: Bruceman

customer_reviews.title: Replaced lost factory control.
customer_reviews.text: Worked just like the one that came with the fan. Easy to program you just need to know the sequence of the tabs on your fan so you can duplicate them on the remote.
customer_reviews.author: TODD P KOKKO

customer_reviews.title: Replaced broke fan remote
customer_reviews.text: The remote came on time, worked on the first try and even dims the fan light on request. Completely satisfied for not much money.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart Bell

customer_reviews.title: Good replacement remote
customer_reviews.text: I got this to replace an old remote that had worn out. It was easy to setup, just had to match the switch sequence from the existing remote.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren G

customer_reviews.title: Successful Replacement!
customer_reviews.text: This combination of remote control/receiver was a clean replacement for the originals. The ceiling fan is over 15 years old. I got both control/receiver to ensure that there would be no compatibility issues between old and new.
customer_reviews.author: Rory Collins

customer_reviews.title: Light Control Broke
customer_reviews.text: The light control broke after 6 months of use. Im not going with this brand anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Aero

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: We had never had a remote with any of our fans, but this was suggested to us for our new house (we only have one light switch on the wall). It was super easy to install and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Schwartz

customer_reviews.title: So far So Good
customer_reviews.text: I installed this in a harbor breeze fan. It was easy to install with clear instructions. The fan is on a 3 season porch and was installed at the end of the season and has not been used much. So I reserve a perfect score for when I find that it continues to work when I really need it
customer_reviews.author: Craig W. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Took a chance and it works perfectly with my fan. I simply set the dip switches to match the remote that I am replacing and it works just like the original. So glad I found this because I have been without a functioning remote for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: brinanc

customer_reviews.title: works just like it should
customer_reviews.text: Works fine. Operator error casues trouble for some of my guests: they poke at the buttons instead of point and hold. Take your time withthe set up, read the instructions so that you set the pins correctly. We use ours in a screened porch, so it gets some exposure to the elements. We have to replace it every couple of years.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Don't replace your whole fan when all you need is this
customer_reviews.text: We determined that our remote control and the fan were fine but the signal was no longer controlling the fan. This product is both the remote and the receiver. The receiver is easy to replace. It's important to make sure the transmission code is set for the remote and the receiver (instructions explain). The initial default code also turned on the fan in an adjacent room, so we had to change it. Many people have probably replaced an entire fan when all they needed was this!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Replacement Remote and Control Module
customer_reviews.text: This is just what was needed. One of our ceiling fans stopped functioning with the remote. The light on the remote lit up so I knew that was okay. Can't find these items locally, so ordered online. You must match the dip switches on the control module to the remote. Then just had to drop the fan to wire the new control module. Done! Works perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: trucke

customer_reviews.title: May work for you, but not for me.
customer_reviews.text: I can't judge fairly. It didnt work for my fan.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Perfect replacement for our fan. Followed the instructions and took me about 30 seconds to set up.
customer_reviews.author: MC

customer_reviews.title: great remote
customer_reviews.text: The light button on my old one quit working, needed a new one, works great.
customer_reviews.author: gary

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Remote is perfect. So easy to install just follow instructions. The old remote just wasn't working and I thought I would have to buy a new fan...so glad I found this replacement.
customer_reviews.author: EYoung

customer_reviews.title: Great Remote!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased a "universal" remote at a box store and it didn't work on our Kitchner fan and had to take it back. Found this one on Amazon, and not only was it less expensive, it is exactly like our old remote and works perfectly! The Kitchner replacement remote is twice the price of this one and they are almost identical in looks. Good to know there is still a bargain out there. .
customer_reviews.author: CRC

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement remote!
customer_reviews.text: My ceiling fan remote stopped working. this worked right out of the box with new batteries, I didn't have to do any programming.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Barnes

customer_reviews.title: ... work for my fan and the build quality felt pretty cheap. If it had worked for my fan ...
customer_reviews.text: Didn't work for my fan and the build quality felt pretty cheap. If it had worked for my fan I would have kept it but kept it in a drawer hidden when not in use because it looks and feels cheap and not something to keep mounted on the wall for others to see.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa S.

customer_reviews.title: Never could get it to work with my fan. Looks identical to my old remote.
customer_reviews.text: Just not compatible with my Home Depot fan. Was supposed to be.
customer_reviews.author: Brian S. Luenser

customer_reviews.title: Problems with setup
customer_reviews.text: I have tried all instructions to pair remote control with harbor breeze ceiling fan with no success.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect replacement
customer_reviews.text: Excellent replacement for the original. My original had an issue turning on the light and dimming them. I kept changing batteries and it made no difference. Decided to try this out and it works just like when I first got the original remote.
customer_reviews.author: Sky Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Wrong installation instructions sent.
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly. The only drawback is instructions sent or for a fan only and not the light. So I had to figure out how to dim the light on my own. Otherwise great product!
customer_reviews.author: RBM

customer_reviews.title: Count the wires on your old one
customer_reviews.text: I knew nothing about these, but when I put a NON dimmable bulb on a dimmable module, my old one gave up. I counted the wires on the one that gave up and bought this one with the exact number of wires. Worked perfectly. Im glad I didn't just by another whole ceiling fan.
customer_reviews.author: Joel

customer_reviews.title: Great Replacement
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for our fan after the remote stopped working. Easy to install
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: Good remote fan control
customer_reviews.text: Installed this on a 60 inch Hunter fan with 100 watts or so of bulbs. Dimmer worked with Led and incandcent bulbs.
customer_reviews.author: Kp

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: The switches inside already matched my original remote so all I had to do was put in the battery. So far works just like the original. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You need to call to find out how to program before you return it thinking it doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: Instructions are poor, so pick up a phone and talk to someone about how to program it, something like turning on and off switches, etc. Once programmed it will work
customer_reviews.author: Becky E.

customer_reviews.title: Just as expected!
customer_reviews.text: Just as expected! Did not work with my fan. Was able to return.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Raub

customer_reviews.title: Works fine
customer_reviews.text: It's a little fragile for my taste, but it works.
customer_reviews.author: Darrin Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: EASY TO INSTALL
customer_reviews.text: I THOUGHT I WOULD HAVE TO THROUGH OUT THE WHOLE FAN. LOCATED THIS REPLACEMENT PART, IT WAS EASY TO CHANGE GOT FAN WORKING AGAIN AND SAVED MYSELF A LOT OF MONEY IN TRYING TO REPLACE THE OLD FAN.
customer_reviews.author: Romie E. Bassetto

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts
customer_reviews.text: You didn’t give me a battery so now I can’t test it. Thanks for nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Ben@VT

customer_reviews.title: Need to already have transmitter
customer_reviews.text: No transmitter piece. My window of return closed before installer looked at it. Don't buy without that.
customer_reviews.author: glal

customer_reviews.title: We used our old remote and dialed it into the same code as the receiver.
customer_reviews.text: We had no need to change the original Hampton Bay remote since it didn't actually fail. The new receiver was labeled perfectly even better then the original [which had no labeling at all] which helped in the installation process.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Bill & Sir Wrigley (Great Dane)

customer_reviews.title: Both died in less than 2 years
customer_reviews.text: I had ordered 2 of these for new fans that I installed in Aug 2018. The first one died a little after a year and the second one just died today, a bit before 2 years was up. These were installed in rooms that are not used often, so there would be little wear and tear on them. Disappointing!
customer_reviews.author: John H. Marshall

customer_reviews.title: They work.
customer_reviews.text: Installed on a pair of fans on my new screen porch. Worked as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Becky D

customer_reviews.title: It worked!! Saved us from buying a new fan
customer_reviews.text: It worked!! Saved us from buying a new fan. We had an Allen+Roth from Lowes. Liked the fan but the original remote unit died. Pluged it in and back up and running.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Moore

customer_reviews.title: air would be nice
customer_reviews.text: haven't been able to get it to work. May be returning if I can't
customer_reviews.author: Joy

customer_reviews.title: Spotty reception
customer_reviews.text: It works when it wants to. If I get right up next to the antenna it works flawlessly but from my bed it's a toss up. I know it's not my remote cause i have another fan that i control from across the house.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Saved money on installation
customer_reviews.text: Added this to my newly installed ceiling fan. Saved the electrician from having to fish wires through the wall for a switch, which saved time and money.
customer_reviews.author: judyj3000

customer_reviews.title: Works like OEM
customer_reviews.text: Replaced original 11-year old OEM remote. Other than the word "Pikeman" on the face you can't tell from original. Just installed battery, set the internal switches, and it works.
customer_reviews.author: voiceover

customer_reviews.title: It is what is says it is
customer_reviews.text: This product is exactly as described (if you bother to read the description, you'll know it is not programmable) and solved the issue I had with mine. One of the buttons quit working. With the new remote all is good.
customer_reviews.author: REE

customer_reviews.title: Workswell!
customer_reviews.text: Works with KUJCE9603 as expected . . . Ours stopped working and this is a good replacement.
customer_reviews.author: J & B Upchurch

customer_reviews.title: Exact replication of the one in the picture.
customer_reviews.text: Worked on the old Hunter fan right out of the box. Even the dip switches were correct. Our Hunter fan is around 20 years old. I'm going to buy another one and put it up, just in case.
customer_reviews.author: David L. Laidig

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work for me, learning feature didn’t do anything
customer_reviews.text: Even though it says it has learning capabilities but it didn’t work with the receiver I have.
customer_reviews.author: KT

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Replacement part for my ceiling fan. It was so much cheaper then buying and installing a new ceiling fan.
customer_reviews.author: amancil

product_meta.title: Pikeman Ceiling Fan Remote Control Replace Hampton Bay Harbor Breeze Hunter KUJCE9103 2AAZPFAN-53T FAN-11T FAN-53T (Just Remote Control)
feature_bullets: It is only a transmitter. This Package does not include a receiver. If your original transmitter looks different from this product, Please purchase a complete kit with a receiver in the store. Note: seasonal changes of forward and reverse cannot be changed with remote
This transmitter is to be purchased only to replace the remote your Fan was originally installed with. You cannot simply add this unit to any Fan that does not already have a receiver pre-installed

Look inside the old remote with the battery cover off. There is a series of "dip" switches (4). with a pen, slide the switches in the new remote to match the same pattern as the old remote. Replace the battery in the new remote and things should work

This is the remote control for the Ceiling Fan. As long as the Fan has the receiver in it this remote will work with your Harbor breeze Ceiling fans, just remember to set the 4 dip switches inside the battery compartment(they are kinda hidden behind the slot for the battery itself)

Make sure the original remote control model is KUJCE9103、FAN-11T or FAN-53T, or make sure your original remote control model is FAN-HD5 or FAN-35T, otherwise the remote control may not match your receiver.
